appreciation: a. “appreciation” means the difference between the market price of the share of a company on the date of exercise of stock appreciation right or vesting of sar, as the case may be, and the sar price;
associate company: b. “associate company” shall have the same meaning as defined under section 2(6) of the companies act, 2013;
board: c. “board” means the securities and exchange board of india or sebi;
control: d. "control" shall have the same meaning as defined under the securities and exchange board of india (substantial acquisition of shares and takeovers) regulations, 2011;
emergency: e. “emergency” means the need of funds by the trust to meet the commitment arising out of the objective of the scheme;
employee: f. “employee” means, — 1[a permanent employee of the company who has been working in india or outside india; or  a director of the company, whether a whole time director or not but excluding an independent director; or  an employee as defined in clause or of a subsidiary, in india or outside india, or of a holding company of the company  1 substituted by securities and exchange board of india (share based employee benefits) regulations, 2015 (w.e.f. 18.09.2015). prior to its substitution, clause read as under: “a permanent employee of the company who has been working in india or outside india; or a director of the company, whether a whole time director or not but excluding an independent director; or an employee as defined in clauses or of a subsidiary, in india or outside india, or of a holding company of the company or of an associate company but does not include—   an employee who is a promoter or a person belonging to the promoter group;     or a director who either himself or through his relative or through any body corporate, directly or indirectly, holds more than ten percent of the outstanding equity shares of the company;” 4 but does not include— an employee who is a promoter or a person belonging to the promoter group; or a director who either himself or through his relative or through any body corporate, directly or indirectly, holds more than ten per cent of the outstanding equity shares of the company; ]
employee stock option scheme or esos: g. “employee stock option scheme or esos” means a scheme under which a company grants employee stock option directly or through a trust;
employee stock purchase scheme or esps: h. “employee stock purchase scheme or esps” means a scheme under which a  company offers shares to employees, as part of public issue or otherwise, or through a trust where the trust may undertake secondary acquisition for the purposes of the scheme;
exercise: i. “exercise” means making of an application by an employee to the company or to the trust for issue of shares or appreciation in form of cash, as the case may be, against vested options or vested sars  in pursuance of the schemes covered under part a or part c of
